home.welcome: Compassionate Therapy for Your Inner Journey
home.videoNotSupported: Your browser does not support the video tag.
home.intro1: At every stage of life, we face challenges that can leave us feeling disconnected from ourselves. You might feel like you've lost confidence in your ability to cope, or you're struggling to find meaning in what once felt certain.
home.intro2: In our work together, I create a safe and welcoming space where your story is fully heard and valued. You hold the deepest wisdom about your life. My role is to walk beside you—holding space, sharing tools, and honoring your journey every step of the way.
home.intro3: As a therapist, my priority is to offer compassionate, genuine care—especially when life feels heavy. My approach is eclectic, but I primarily use Internal Family Systems (IFS) as my guiding framework.
home.intro4: Deep healing begins when we approach every part of ourselves—the wounded, the angry, the lonely, even the parts we dislike—with curiosity rather than judgment.
home.quote: Healing isn't about 'fixing' yourself—it's about awakening the resilience and wholeness already within you. When you're ready to begin, I'm here.

about.title: Meet Siya
about.educationText: I hold a Master of Science in Psychotherapy from McMaster University and am a Registered Psychotherapist (Qualifying) with the CRPO. With over six years of experience across diverse settings—from crisis helplines to community programs and family health teams—I've learned that real healing emerges when therapy is collaborative, culturally responsive, and grounded in real-world challenges.
about.experienceText: My 3,000+ hours of counselling experience include supporting adolescents and adults through immediate relief (single-session interventions), focused growth (short-term therapy for specific goals), and deep healing (longer-term work for complex trauma). This work unfolded within organizations like the Canadian Mental Health Association, Hamilton Family Health Team, and Distress Centres of Greater Toronto.
about.howIWorkText: I specialize in helping you meet wounded, protective, or disliked aspects of yourself with curiosity—especially self-critical parts that whisper 'you're not good enough.' Through Internal Family Systems-informed interventions, we'll gently reconnect you with your calm, compassionate core Self. When we meet our inner world without judgment, we transform suffering at its source—cultivating not just balance, but enduring self-trust.
about.beyondTherapyText: Beyond therapy, life with my three cats—especially my serene white companion—teaches daily lessons in boundaries, rest, and radical self-honoring. Their instinctive wisdom mirrors what I hope for you: that prioritizing your needs becomes second nature, not guilt—a foundation for authentic growth.
about.pullQuote: The world is not perfect, and we all hold fragments within us—parts shaped by wounds, by sorrow, by moments that left us fractured. Along the 'Way of Self,' I walk beside you as a guiding light, helping these exiled parts find safety, compassion, and finally, home.
about.heroQuote: Therapy is not about fixing you—it's about helping you come home to yourself.

services.title: Psychotherapy Services

Together, we'll cultivate curiosity and insight in a judgment-free environment where every part of you is valued and embraced.

faq1.a: Yes, we do! Please confirm coverage for psychotherapy with your insurance provider. We can also provide a fee quote with details to help you verify benefits. Common providers include Manulife, Sun Life, GreenShield, Blue Cross, and Telus Health. However, coverage varies by plan.

faq2.q: Do you offer sliding scale rates?
faq2.a: Yes, we offer reduced fees for clients without insurance, those with limited coverage, and international students. Don’t hesitate to contact us directly to discuss options.

faq3.a: Psychotherapists can provide clinical letters based on your assessment and needs. However, acceptance is determined by your institution (e.g., school or workplace). We recommend clarifying their requirements first. To be noted, most institutions require documentation from a physician, psychologist, psychiatrist, or licensed medical provider.

faq4.q: How long are sessions, and how often will we meet?
faq4.a: Sessions are typically 50 minutes. Most clients begin with weekly appointments, but we’ll tailor frequency to your needs and adjust as you progress. We’ll discuss what works best for you during our initial consultation.

faq5.a: Yes—with rare exceptions required by law. Your privacy is foundational to our work. We’ll explain confidentiality in detail during our first session, including limits like imminent safety risks, child protection concerns, or court orders. You’re always welcome to ask questions about privacy at any time.

faq6.q: How do I know if we’re a good fit?
faq6.a:
Therapy works best when you feel truly safe, heard, and understood. While building trust takes time, your comfort matters from day one.

To help you decide, we offer a free 20-minute phone/video consultation. We’ll talk about your hopes for therapy, answer all your questions, and explore whether working together feels right. No pressure, no strings.
